documents.content:
# California ABC 2025-2026 Legislative Changes

## New Laws Affecting Liquor Licensing

### SB 395 - San Francisco Hospitality Zone (Effective January 1, 2026)
- **What:** Creates up to 20 new Type 47 licenses in downtown San Francisco
- **Allocation:** Maximum 10 licenses in first year, then 5 per year
- **Anti-Flipping Provision:** Licenses CANNOT be sold above the original state fee
- **Purpose:** Help SF restaurants recover from pandemic and downtown vacancy crisis
- **Restriction:** Must remain in designated hospitality zone

### AB 828 - Los Angeles Type 87 Licenses (Effective January 1, 2026)
- **What:** Creates up to 40 new neighborhood-restricted licenses in LA County
- **Type 87:** Special full-liquor license tied to specific census tracts
- **Allocation:** Maximum 12 licenses per year
- **Restriction:** Cannot be transferred to different census tract
- **Purpose:** Expand restaurant options in underserved LA neighborhoods

### AB 1008 - San Luis Obispo (Effective January 1, 2026)
- **What:** Up to 10 additional Type 47 licenses for SLO County
- **Allocation:** Maximum 5 per year
- **Purpose:** Support growing tourism and food scene

### AB 233 - Colusa County (Effective January 1, 2026)
- **What:** Up to 10 additional Type 47 licenses
- **Purpose:** Rural area development

### CPI Fee Adjustment (January 1, 2026)
- All ABC fees increased 2.72% per Consumer Price Index formula
- Affects application fees, annual fees, and transfer fees

### LA Restaurant Beverage Program (Ongoing)
- Streamlined local approval in eligible council districts
- Timeline: 6-10 weeks (vs 6-12 months for traditional CUP)
- Cost: ~$1,500-$3,000 (vs ~$13,000 for CUP)
- Eligible Districts: 2, 3, 4, 5, 10, 11, 15
- URL: https://planning.lacity.gov/restaurant-beverage-program

### Official Source
https://www.abc.ca.gov/2025-chaptered-legislation/
